author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Lions Reveal Exciting Jared Goff News
text:
Lions Reveal Exciting Jared Goff News
The Detroit Lions have announced that franchise quarterback Jared Goff will be featured in the upcoming season of Netflix‚Äôs ‚ÄúQuarterback,‚Äù set to premiere in July. After a disappointing playoff exit to the Washington Commanders, the Lions are embracing a revitalized narrative following some coaching adjustments and roster changes. Goff's journey will provide an in-depth look at the Lions during their successful 15-2 2024 season, contrasted with the heartache of their abrupt playoff conclusion. He joins Joe Burrow of the Bengals and Kirk Cousins of the Falcons in this highly anticipated series.
- Goff led the Lions to a 15-2 record in the 2024 season.
- Joe Burrow achieved 4,918 passing yards and 43 touchdowns in the 2024-25 season.
While Goff's selection for the series excites fans, it's tempered by the reality that despite a stellar season, the Lions faced a swift playoff exit, highlighting the ongoing challenges of postseason success in the NFL.
State of Play- Goff is the only participating quarterback who reached the playoffs, creating a compelling storyline for his segment.
- Fans are eager for insights into how Goff navigated the Lions' highly competitive 2024 season.
As the release of ‚ÄúQuarterback‚Äù approaches, expectations rise around how Goff's narrative will unfold, showcasing both the highs of the regular season and the lows of the playoffs. The Lions will look to use this attention to build momentum for the next season.
Bottom LineJared Goff's inclusion in ‚ÄúQuarterback‚Äù is a significant platform for the Lions, representing both the team‚Äôs success and their quest for postseason redemption. This exposure could help shape public perception and galvanize the fanbase as they aim for a deeper playoff run next season.
Read more at Heavy Sports

author: Katelynn Richardson
title: There Is Near Zero Historical Precedent For Biden DOJ Getting Steve Bannon Thrown In Jail | The Daily Caller
text:
There‚Äôs almost no historical precedent for the Biden Department of Justice‚Äôs (DOJ) effort to have Steve Bannon serve time in jail for his conviction on contempt of Congress charges.
After an appeals court upheld in May Bannon‚Äôs conviction on contempt of Congress charges for ignoring a Jan. 6 select committee subpoena, the DOJ asked the district court judge who initially issued Bannon‚Äôs four-month prison sentence to order him to report to prison. Judge Carl J. Nichols agreed Thursday, ending the hold on his nearly unprecedented sentence that had been in place during his appeal.
Bannon now must report to prison by July 1. Besides former President Donald Trump aide Peter Navarro, who is currently serving a four-month sentence for contempt of Congress, one of the most recent historical precedents for such a sentence dates to the Cold War, when a group of writers, directors and producers known as the ‚ÄúHollywood Ten‚Äù were sentenced to jail time for refusing to cooperate with the House Un-American Activities Committee (HUAC), according to the Washington Post.
The ten believed questions posed by the HUAC violated their First Amendment rights, but the House voted to hold them in contempt in November 1947 for refusing to state whether they were members of the Communist Party, according to Politico.
My Statement on Steve Bannon‚Äôs Prison Sentence:
We have had constitutional executive privilege for 250 years‚Äìgoing back to George Washington‚Äìso the President of the United States can receive candid, confidential advice from his advisors without fear their advice will get‚Ä¶
‚Äî üá∫üá∏ Mike Davis üá∫üá∏ (@mrddmia) June 6, 2024
Former Richard Nixon aide G. Gordon Liddy and former Nixon Attorney General Richard Kleindienst pleaded guilty to contempt of Congress charges but did not go to jail, according to the Washington Post. (RELATED: ‚ÄòMiddle Finger To The House‚Äô: Joe Biden Said Subpoena Defiers Should Be Charged. Will His DOJ Arrest Hunter?)
‚ÄúWhile there is a fair amount of precedent for lying to Congress, there is far less for people convicted of contempt of Congress,‚Äù John Malcolm, vice president for the Heritage Foundation‚Äôs Institute for Constitutional Government and former deputy assistant attorney general in the DOJ‚Äôs Criminal Division, told the Daily Caller News Foundation in January.
Navarro, former trade advisor to Trump, was ordered to report to a Miami prison on March 19, where he began his four-month sentence. After Navarro was indicted in June 2022, the FBI arrested him at Reagan National Airport in Washington, D.C., when he was heading to a Nashville speaking engagement, according to Politico.
Hunter Biden, who defied a congressional subpoena in December, choosing to hold a press conference on Capitol Hill rather than sit for his deposition, has not yet been found in contempt of Congress.
Criminal defense attorney and legal analyst Philip Holloway told the Daily Caller News Foundation in December that the law ‚Äúmust be applied equally or it has no meaning,‚Äù arguing Hunter Biden should ‚Äúbe held to the same standard‚Äù as Bannon.
The House Judiciary Committee and House Oversight Committee voted in May to advance resolutions to hold Attorney General Merrick Garland in contempt of Congress for defying their request to turn over audio recordings from special counsel Robert Hur‚Äôs interview with President Joe Biden.
After the House voted to cite former President Barack Obama‚Äôs Attorney General Eric Holder in contempt of Congress in 2012, Holder faced no jail time, as the DOJ did not initiate criminal prosecution.
White House spokesman Jay Carney said at the time that it is ‚Äúan established principle, dating back to the administration of President Ronald Reagan, that the Justice Department does not pursue prosecution in a contempt case when the president has asserted executive privilege,‚Äù according to CNN.
‚ÄúWe have had constitutional executive privilege for 250 years‚Äìgoing back to George Washington‚Äìso the President of the United States can receive candid, confidential advice from his advisors without fear their advice will get publicly aired before courts or Congress,‚Äù Mike Davis, founder and president of the Article III Project, wrote Thursday on X. ‚ÄúPresident Biden and his Attorney General Merrick Garland have shamefully destroyed this, in their partisan quest to politicize and weaponize the Biden Justice Department to go after President Trump and his top aides.‚Äù
Bannon said Thursday outside the courthouse that there is ‚Äúnot a prison built or jail built that will ever shut me up.‚Äù
‚ÄúThey‚Äôre not going to shut up Trump, they‚Äôre not going to shut up Navarro, they‚Äôre not going to shut up Bannon, and they‚Äôre certainly not going to shut up MAGA,‚Äù Bannon said . ‚ÄúThere is nothing that can shut me up and there is nothing that will shut me up.‚Äù
All content created by the Daily Caller News Foundation, an independent and nonpartisan newswire service, is available without charge to any legitimate news publisher that can provide a large audience. All republished articles must include our logo, our reporter‚Äôs byline and their DCNF affiliation. For any questions about our guidelines or partnering with us, please contact licensing@dailycallernewsfoundation.org .

author: ansa.it
title: Zanettin, intervenire su carenze organico sede Inps Vicenza - PMI - Ansa.it
text:
"Rispetto alla situazione di emergenza che sta vivendo la sede Inps di Vicenza, con una grave carenza di organico che si ripercuote sui servizi all'utenza, devo purtroppo dichiararmi insoddisfatto dalla risposta del governo, o meglio dall'istruttoria predisposta dagli uffici del Ministero del Lavoro. La provincia di Vicenza √® la terza in Italia per produzione industriale pro capite. Abbiamo un tessuto industriale straordinariamente fecondo, con imprese che esportano in tutto il mondo. I ritardi nella risposta amministrativa sono inaccettabili". Lo ha detto il senatore vicentino di Forza Italia Pierantonio Zanettin presentando la sua interrogazione nell'aula del Senato.
 "Nel 2020 - ha proseguito - l'organico della sede INPS di Vicenza era di 220 persone, oggi sono 184. Per quanto riguarda i dati dell'ultimo concorso, le assegnazioni del 2023 che sono state fatte in Veneto hanno visto arrivare a Vicenza solo 48 risorse. Tra l'altro, alla fine di quest'anno ne resteranno in servizio appena 41. Sono rimasto, peraltro, molto sorpreso del fatto che le chiusure delle sedi Inps di Thiene ed Arzignano, secondo la risposta del Ministero, sarebbero dovute allo scarso interesse da parte dei comuni interessati". "La mia interrogazione, infatti, √® stata sollecitata anche dal sindaco di Thiene. Credo piuttosto che queste chiusure dipendano, appunto, dalle carenze di organico a cui auspico si possa porre rimedio. Dovremo ragionare su concorsi regionali e sulla possibilit√† di prevedere alloggi a prezzi calmierati per ovviare alle difficolt√† derivanti da stipendi troppo bassi, che creano difficolt√† soprattutto ai vincitori di concorso che provengono da altre regioni", ha concluso.

author: @Our Correspondent
title: P@SHA calls VPN ban ‚Äò$1bn threat‚Äô to IT industry
text:
KARACHI: The Pakistan Software Houses Association (P@SHA) has once again raised alarm over the severe repercussions of internet disruptions and the potential blocking of virtual private network (VPN) services, warning that such measures could cripple Pakistan‚Äôs thriving IT sector.
On Wednesday, Chairperson of P@SHA Sajjad Mustafa Syed appeared on a talk show on a private TV channel and cautioned that banning VPNs could devastate the IT sector ‚ÄúThe industry could face a $1 billion loss within the first year, with further declines in subsequent years,‚Äù he said.
He said that according to preliminary findings, the IT industry has recorded a 30 per cent drop in orders. This, he said, could translate into a revenue loss of billions of dollars. In terms of job losses, this dip in order number will wipe out around 200,000 to 300,000 jobs from the industry.
This is not the first time for P@SHA‚Äôs wake-up call for the government. In August, when Pakistan faced sudden internet disruptions, the then vice president of P@SHA, Ali Ihsan, released a strongly worded letter where he said that ‚Äúinternet disruptions could inflict devastating financial losses estimated to reach $300 million.‚Äù
Sajjad said that not only do internet disruptions result in revenue losses, they also lead to penalties. He said that some time back when there was a two-hour-long internet shutdown, an IT firm was slapped with a $2 million penalty. He said that IT firms are service providers, and they have certain targets to meet. Failure to do so will definitely meet with penalties from clients.
Addressing concerns, the chairperson said the restriction is reportedly being imposed due to its misuse by terrorists. While acknowledging the significance of national security, he highlighted that such challenges exist globally.
‚ÄúWe stand firmly with our institutions in the fight against terrorism. However, the white-listing approach for VPNs will harm the IT sector,‚Äù he added. Syed proposed an alternative solution, suggesting the establishment of an industry for VPN service providers to ensure monitoring and prevent misuse by terrorists.
Syed urged the government to avoid a blanket ban on VPNs, advocating instead for a collaborative approach involving P@SHA, industry leaders, and stakeholders to create a balanced and secure framework.
‚ÄúWe must safeguard national security without jeopardising the operational needs of Pakistan‚Äôs IT sector, which is vital for the country‚Äôs economic growth,‚Äù he concluded.

author: Roberta Mercuri
title: Megan Fox e Machine Gun Kelly, dopo la rottura i rapporti sono ¬´cos√¨ gelidi che lui potrebbe non essere presente alla nascita del loro bambino¬ª
text:
La rottura tra Megan Fox e Machine Gun Kelly risale allo scorso dicembre, quando lei secondo il gossip avrebbe scoperto messaggi compromettenti sul cellulare del compagno. L'attrice trentottenne, solo un mese prima, aveva annunciato via social di aspettare il suo quarto figlio, il primo con il trentaquattrenne musicista. Ma ora i rapporti tra gli ex fidanzati sarebbero ¬´cos√¨ gelidi che non √® chiaro se Machine Gun Kelly sar√† presente quando nascer√† il bambino¬ª. Lo scrive Tmz, precisando che √® stata Megan Fox a voler interrompere ogni contatto col cantante: ¬´Non vuole avere niente a che fare con l'ex. E tutti coloro che la circondano ne sono felici. Sentono che, allontanandolo dalla sua vita, √® tornata in s√©¬ª.
La storia tra Megan Fox e Machine Gun Kelly - che si sono conosciuti nel 2019 girando una clip musicale - era sta ufficializzata via social nel luglio 2020 (solo tre mesi prima lei aveva detto addio al marito Brian Austin Green, da cui ha avuto tre figli). Durante i quattro anni di fidanzamento l'attrice e il cantante, tra rotture e ritorni di fiamma, ci avevano abituato a ogni sorta di bizzarria. Ad esempio nell'aprile 2022 lei in un'intervista aveva rivelato: ¬´Beviamo il sangue l'uno dell'altra¬ª. Precisando, forse a vantaggio dei lettori troppo impressionabili, che la gente ¬´non deve immaginarci con i calici in stile Game of Thrones mentre beviamo il nostro sangue. Sono solo poche gocce in realt√†¬ª. Qualche mese prima Megan, postando una foto in cui il rapper le faceva la proposta di nozze, aveva scritto: ¬´Mi ha chiesto di sposarlo. E proprio come in ogni vita prima di questa, e come in ogni vita che seguir√†, ho detto s√¨‚Ä¶ e poi abbiamo bevuto il sangue l‚Äôuna dell‚Äôaltro¬ª.
Il matrimonio non √® mai stato celebrato, e lo scorso dicembre √® arrivata la notizia dell'ennesima rottura tra i due: ¬´Durante una vacanza in Colorado per il Giorno del Ringraziamento¬ª, aveva spiegato a Tmz una fonte vicina all'ex coppia, ¬´Megan ha iniziato ad avere dei sospetti, ha controllato il telefono del fidanzato e ha trovato messaggi compromettenti che coinvolgevano altre donne. Cos√¨ ha deciso di lasciarlo¬ª. Da allora i due non si sarebbero pi√π visti. E i rapporti sarebbero cos√¨ gelidi che lui, alla nascita del loro bambino, potrebbe non essere presente.

author: The Hindu Bureau
title: 7.5 km stormwater drain connecting three lakes planned to prevent inundation - The Hindu
text:
The stormwater drain connecting the lakes of Masab Cheruvu, Dilavar Khan Cheruvu and Pedda Amberpet Cheruvu towards Ibrahimpatnam area of Rangareddy district is set to be developed as a model drain.
Hyderabad Disaster Response & Asset Protection Agency (HYDRAA) commissioner A.V. Ranganath revealed the plans to develop the 7.5 kilometre drain, in order to prevent inundation. A coordination meeting will be organised soon with officials from Revenue, Municipal, Irrigation and other departments, to prepare a plan of action, he said.
Mr. Ranganath, together with the MLA of Ibrahimpatnam Malreddy Ranga Reddy inspected the lower reaches of the drain on Wednesday (July 9, 2025) in view of several complaints of inundation from the residents of surrounding colonies. He inspected the double bedroom houses at Jalikunta between Masab Cheruvu and Dilavar Khan Cheruvu, and the structures stalled owing to inundation of basement nearby.
Since the area is not fully constructed, the drain has the scope of modification based on the future needs, Mr. Ranganath said, and urged the local residents to ensure that the lakes are free of encroachment. He assured action against encroachers of Masab Cheruvu. He also inspected the obstacles for nala widening at Karmanghat and Badangpet, and visited the Raviryal Lake.
Published - July 10, 2025 01:47 pm IST

author: LMNeuquen
title: En un partido ins√≥lito: Boca qued√≥ eliminado de la Sudamericana por penales
text:

El gol de Boca lo marc√≥ el delantero Milton Gim√©nez , a los tres minutos de adici√≥n. Los goles del equipo brasile√±o los marcaron los mediocampistas Matheus Henrique y Walace , a los nueve y 21 minutos, respectivamente.
A los 30 segundos de partido, cuando apenas se hab√≠a movido la pelota del medio, Luis Adv√≠ncula lleg√≥ tarde a una pelota y pis√≥ el tobillo de su rival. El √°rbitro Wilmar Rold√°n no tuvo dudas y sac√≥ una roja r√©cord para dejar al Xeneize con uno menos desde el arranque.

Conforme pasaron los minutos y el Xeneize se qued√≥ sin piernas, Cruzeiro retom√≥ el dominio y convirti√≥ a Chiquito Romero en h√©roe, que tap√≥ lo que era un golazo de Matheus Pereira para liquidar la serie.

As√≠ llegaban Boca y Cruzeiro Boca lleg√≥ envalentonado a este compromiso, ya que en la ida super√≥ a su rival por 1 a 0 con gol de Edinson Cavani y luego se qued√≥ con el cl√°sico ante San Lorenzo por 3 a 2. La entidad de La Ribera tuvo que atravesar los 16avos de final para acceder a octavos porque fue segundo en la zona D de la etapa de grupos con 11 puntos en seis partidos disputados (tres victorias, dos empates y una derrota). En esta instancia de eliminaci√≥n directa dej√≥ en el camino a Independiente del Valle de Ecuador con un global de 1-0.
Por su parte, Cruzeiro con la derrota de la ida, cedi√≥ el invicto en el certamen luego de una primera etapa en la que fue l√≠der del grupo B con 12 puntos producto de tres alegr√≠as y la misma cantidad de igualdades. Esto le vali√≥ acceder directamente a octavos de final sin necesidad de pasar por la instancia de repechaje. En el Brasileirao marcha s√©ptimo con 37 unidades, a nueve puntos del l√≠der Botafogo luego de empatar el √∫ltimo fin de semana contra Vit√≥ria 2 a 2.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Gabby Williams Provides Midseason Motivation for Seattle Storm
text:
By Chelsea Leite ,
2 hours ago The Seattle Storm already had a strong roster, but the midseason addition of Gabby Williams brings them to a higher level.
Williams is a world-class veteran and fits a needed role in Seattle that will help give the Storm an edge in the playoffs. The Storm already have clinched a playoff berth and are fighting for a top-four seed and home court in the first round. Every contending WNBA team boasts several stars, and Williams helps the Storm get level to the teams they‚Äôre chasing.
Williams was crucial to the Storm‚Äôs win against the second-place Connecticut Sun on Tuesday, with 11 points, six rebounds, five assists and a steal to go with 5-for-8 shooting from the field. The Sun are a team the Storm may end up seeing in the playoffs, so getting the win factors in as a huge confidence boost. As Williams acclimates back to WNBA basketball after the Olympics, her impact will continue to grow on Seattle‚Äôs roster.
Williams was drafted fourth overall out of UConn in 2018 by the Chicago Sky and spent her first three WNBA seasons with that franchise. Now, she‚Äôs in her third season with the Storm. She also has a lengthy r√©sum√© in the Euroleague and plays for the French national team.
Seattle Storm forward Gabby Williams dribbles the ball against the New York Liberty at Climate Pledge Arena on May 29, 2022. Stephen Brashear-Imagn Images
Fans were stunned by Williams and the French when they nearly beat Team USA in the gold medal game at the Paris Olympics, ultimately falling 67-66. She averaged 14.8 points, 4.2 rebounds, 5.4 assists and 2.8 steals per game for the silver medalists.
Seattle made some huge moves in free agency by attracting Skylar Diggins-Smith and Nneka Ogwumike. They join Jewell Loyd to lead this Storm roster, and Ezi Magbegor has blossomed into an excellent center as well. Ultimately, Williams‚Äô veteran presence bonds well alongside Seattle‚Äôs other stars. Teams need veteran experience to succeed in the playoffs, as they usually know how to keep calm and meet the moment. Williams may not have snatched the gold medal, but she played phenomenally under pressure in Paris.
Williams is the kind of player who affects a game in myriad ways. She doesn‚Äôt always rack up points, but she is an elite defender and passer. On a roster where you have shooters like Loyd and Diggins-Smith in the backcourt and Ogwumike and Magbegor in the frontcourt, a passer like Williams is like glue. She‚Äôs strong enough to drive to the basket when needed and has the size to crash the glass. On the defensive side, her strength and wingspan make her a scary matchup.
Having a versatile player like Williams on a playoff team serves a variety of purposes ‚Äî for one, a player who‚Äôs willing to do the dirty work on the court is essential. Plus, she knows the staff and team atmosphere from her previous seasons with the Storm. Seattle could not have done any better in terms of a midseason acquisition.
Williams might have extra motivation this postseason. Virtually every team the Storm could face in the postseason will have a member of the Team USA squad that edged out France for gold just a month ago. Maybe Williams will be playing for a WNBA championship with a little bit of redemption on the side. Related: Why Caitlin Clark Is Running Away With the WNBA Rookie of the Year Award
